node.title: Sudan military to reinstate ousted prime minister, release arrested officials
node.description: Military and government officials say a deal has been reached between Sudan's military and civilian leaders to reinstate Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok, who was deposed in the October 25 coup, with detainedÂ government officials and politicians also to be released.
node.content:
["A deal has been reached between Sudan's military and civilian leaders to reinstate Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok, who was deposed in a coup last month.", "Military and government leaders confirmed the agreement on Sunday, adding\u00a0that government officials and politicians arrested since the October 25 coup would\u00a0be released as part of the deal\u00a0between the military and political parties, including the largest Umma Party.", "Mr Hamdok will lead an independent technocratic Cabinet, the officials said.", "They said the United Nations., United States and others played \"crucial roles\" in crafting the agreement.", "The officials\u00a0spoke on condition of anonymity, discussing the deal ahead of\u00a0the official announcement.", "", "
Sudan was thrown into chaos after the October 25 coup.(Reuters: El Tayeb Siddig)
", "Sudan's coup \u2014\u00a0more than two years after a popular uprising forced the removal of longtime autocrat Omar al-Bashir and his Islamist government \u2014\u00a0has drawn international criticism.", "The US, its allies and the United Nations have condemned the use of excessive force against anti-coup protesters.", "Sudanese have been taking to the streets in masses since the military takeover, which up-ended the country's fragile transition to democracy.", "The agreement comes just days after doctors said at least 15 people were killed by live fire during anti-coup demonstrations.", "", "
General\u00a0Abdel-Fattah Burhan heads the Sudanese military which staged last month's coup.,\u00a0(AP: Sudan TV)
", "The military has tightened its grip on power, appointing a new, military-run Sovereign Council, chaired by coup leader General Abdel-Fattah Burhan.", "The Sovereign Council will meet later on Sunday before announcing the deal, the officials said.", "A national initiative formed after the coup, which\u00a0includes political parties and public figures, said in a statement that Mr Hamdok would be reinstated and would\u00a0form a technocratic Cabinet.", "It said the deal would be signed later on Sunday, along with a political declaration.\u00a0", "Mohmmed Youssef al-Mustafa, a spokesman for the Sudanese Professionals Association, said there was\u00a0a deal but the SPA would only comment when it is announced officially.", "AP/ABC"]
